headline: Holiday Cranberry Sauce
description: No Thanksgiving or Christmas table is complete without a sweet-tart sauce made from fresh cranberries, sugar, and spices.
name: Holiday Cranberry Sauce

recipeInstructions.text: Wrap cinnamon sticks, cloves, and allspice berries in a spice bag.
Combine cranberries, water, and spice bag in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Cook until cranberries begin to burst, about 10 minutes.
Stir in sugar and reduce the heat to low. Continue cooking until sugar dissolves, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat and let cool to room temperature, about 30 minutes.
Remove and discard spice bag. Cover cranberry sauce and chill in the refrigerator before serving, 8 hours to overnight.

review.reviewBody: I loved it. I drastically reduced the sugar--1/4 cup was enough for me. I added an orange, which I saw in some other recipes. Nice addition. I like this recipe because it calls for few ingredients and is easy.

This dish turned out great! I had a hard time finding whole allspice berries though. Fortunately, my wife had a multi spice pack for an apple cider recipe, so I took them from that. Lol… She’s normally not a fan of cranberry sauce, but really liked this one. Definitely adding this to my recipe book!
Family members who don't like cranberry sauce love this recipe.

AMAZING!! Used orange juice instead of water, grated orange peel right on top then cooked it all together for 20 mins. Delish!! I now use this cranberry sauce to swirl through my cheesecake recipe during the holidays for an incredible cranberry cheesecake dessert!

Family loved it. Instead of putting spices in cheesecloth I just placed the spices in the 1-1/2 c. water WITHOUT the cranberries and let the spices steep in the warm water on low for 10-minutes. Then I took out the spices and added the cranberries making the recipe as instructed. I think it adds more spice to the dish.
This is the best tasting cranberry sauce I've had. My brother said the same and asked me to share it with him.
Delicious and will make again
So DELICIOUS! I will make this every year!

I liked the idea of adding spices but used what I had on hand. I reduced the sugar to 1/2c because I subbed in Orange juice for water. I threw in a lemon zinger tea bag that I opened and put in 1 1/2 tsp of ground cloves and then tied it shut with string and added 3 cinnamon sticks. The result was a great spicy not too sweet taste. Do heat the water before putting in the berries for a more gelled result
wonderful! i made this for the first time this thanksgiving and it was a hit. i’m amazed how easy it was to make. however, i cut back on sugar because my husband is a diabetic.

I didn't want to mess with making a bag of spices, so I just threw ground cloves and allspice in with the cranberries and cinnamon sticks. Then I remembered another recipe that took orange zest and how much I enjoyed that; not having any oranges, I added some orange extract and it turned out fantastic!! I will definitely make this again and add the same extract. Unfortunately I can't tell you how much....I just added what looked right and tasted good.
I made it with orange juice. It's wonderful.

I put a scoop of orange marmalade in with the water and used a cup of brown sugar in place of the white sugar. I also added a sprinkle of ground cloves, allspice and nutmeg. It was a HIT! Thank you for this recipe.

This was delicious!!! I will be making this again, but I think I will see if I can reduce the sugar, it was a little sweet after it sat. I couldn't find allspice berries so I used 1/4 tsp of ground allspice. I made "Cranberry Sauce Extraordinaire" as well to compare the two of them. This is a true sauce the other one is more of a salad. We prefer this one over the Extraordinaire recipe. My 5 yr old gobbled this up!
I love this simple recipe. It is the only recipe I use (open to suggestions though).

Wow! This is incredible. I can’t believe how good it tastes. I used 1 1/2 cups of sugar like others suggested. Also used one cup fresh orange juice and the rest water. Added zest of one orange. When cooled I blended slightly with immersion blender for texture. But it would be fine without blending. Truly delicious.
I added 1tsp cornstarch and used 2 parts water and 1 part orange juice.
If you are reading the reviews and wondering if you should make this, let me make this simple for you. MAKE THIS. You'll never buy cranberry sauce from the can again. I promise.
This is a great recipe. There is no allspice in it.

Wonderful! I didn’t have the allspice berries, but added about 2 tsp. of orange zest. I also didn’t have a spice bag, so put the spices in a coffee filter and closed it securely with a clean rubber band. I will probably cut the sugar back to 1-1/2 cups next time, as I thought it was a little too sweet.

Delicious and easy recipe. Who knew that making cranberry sauce was so simple and so much more delicious than the can stuff. I did take everyone else's advice and brought the sauce to a boil first (it only makes sense). I also followed another person's advice and added some orange zest, which REALLY set the taste of the top. I did only add a couple of pinches though, so it wouldn't overpower the sauce. I will definitely be making again and not just for the holidays.

I have been making this cranberry sauce for years! It’s absolutely my favorite part of Thanksgiving. I make extra to put on left over turkey sandwiches...makes a great chutney. It’s great on pork as well. Soooo good!
Very good and easy...will definitely make again. Used orange juice and 1-1/2 cups of sugar as suggested by others.

I have been making this every year for years. It's so good! I use a coffee filter tied with string because who has spice bags? I do reduce the sugar. Even my extra picky nephew loves it. It's all he wants to eat at holiday meals.

Holy yum! I just made this and it is phenomenal. I swapped orange juice for the water and added spices to our taste. I also simmered and simmered letting the cranberries take as long as they wanted to break and then some, ultimately 45 mins. So freaking worth it!! I am seriously considering making it year round.
I've been making this since Thanksgiving 2008 it is wonderful!
I've been making this since Thanksgiving 2008 it is wonderful!
Loved it! Will make it with every turkey!!

Everyone loved it! My husband said he’s officially been converted from the can. LOL! Simple and easy to make. I only used 1 1/2 C of sugar simply because we ran out. Still perfectly sweet without overdoing. This will be our go-to every holiday from now on!

I've made this recipe twice now, once a few years ago for Christmas and again this year for my family on Christmas as well. 

Before I made this sauce, i never really liked cranberry sauce. To me it was the nasty artificial looking canned sauce you buy at the store even if no one likes it. My family did this every year I grew up for both of the "Christian" holidays, Thanksgiving and Christmas. I saw the recipe and it sounded great so I thought I'd give it a try. As many other reviewers already stated, the sauce is delicious. The spices infused with the bursting berries add a complex and very seasonally appropriate flavor to a traditionally boring recipe in serious need of an update.
This was an awesome dish to make. My family & friends really enjoy this dish. I added it to my collection!
This was delicious and easy. used mulling spices that I had on hand and added a little amaretto and used a bit less sugar. the family is already requesting that I make it again.
Delicious! I’ll be making this recipe every year!
Made it exactly as written and it was amazing
Quick, easy, delicious. Loved the spices. Looking forward to my turkey and cranberry sauce sandwich tomorrow!
Love this recipe! My family has started specifically requesting that I bring this to dinner.

I was looking forward and to this s recipe, Andy made it yesterday. Realizing there was a lot of sugar included, I actually cut it down to only 1 cup, but despite this the recipe is WAY too sweet. Also, the cloves taste is overpowering. 
Sor4y, I don’t like this recipe at all, and I won’t make it again. It’s back to cranberries plus oranges, mixed in a blender, without much sugar. I could eat that at every meal, Andy certainly at every holiday.
Easy and so delicious

For most of my life, I *HATED* cranberry sauce. My dad, however, loved it. One year I went looking for recipes and found this one. Very simple to make, and smells delightful.

I wiped up a bit that had spilled down the side of the container, and tasted that. Surprisingly tasty, bright and fresh and not too sweet. (I cut the amount of sugar like some other reviews.) Then I licked the spoon I'd stirred it with. I realized I'd fallen in love when I sat down with the cooking pot and a spoon to get every last drop of tart deliciousness. This recipe made me a cranberry convert!

I make this every year for Thanksgiving and Christmas. If you're an experimental cook, don't be afraid to play with it. Put the zest of one orange in it. Since you bought an orange, throw the juice in too, and add water to make the called-for volume. You can double the called-for amounts of spices if your tastes buds need a wake-up call. You can even throw a shot of pomegranate liqueur into it after you turn the heat down, which is DELICIOUS btw. I change it a little every year, and every year my family, friends, and coworkers clamor for more.
I have been making this cranberry sauce for years now and it is always a hit. I have been asked for the recipe a few times now. I follow the directions exactly, no need to change anything.
Easy to make! I followed the recipe! Very delicious!
Total hit

This cranberry sauce is delicious! I made it this past weekend for our Thanksgiving here in Canada. It was a hit! Everyone enjoyed it and couldn't believe it was home made. I didn't change anything except to add a little more sugar and before I discarded the spice bag, I took out some of the cinnamon sticks and kept them in the cranberry sauce.
Absolutely phenomenal!
I make this every year and it's always a hit. I substituted half of the water with oj
I love this recipe. So easy to make. The boasting flavour of cranberries and spices. Very tasty. Great with chicken, turkey, and pork. I’d even use it as a condiment with cheese and crackers.
Loved the subtle spice in this recipe. Great improvement on plain cranberry sauce
Everybody loved it!! They even requested to take home with them!!

I have made this twice now. Both times to use in Banana Cranberry Bread on this site. I didn't have whole spices, so I used ground. It smells so divine cooking! I would most likely use the whole spices if I were not combining it with other ingredients as it would make for a clearer gel. Definitely easy to prepare and yummy to eat!

Didn't change anything it was awesome. 
I may add orange juice next time, but if i don't have it, it's ok. It's delicious as it is
This was my first attempt at making Cranberry sauce & it came out spectacularly! It was so simple & tasted better than any I’ve had in the past. Will definitely make this again!
Hugh hit. Definitely a keeper. Will be making this again and again.

Followed the recipe except sugar .Used 1 cup. Easy recipe, great flavor, and compliments from everyone including a few picky family members! I had 2 cans of cranberry sauce for back up, donated them to food bank. Thank you for a great recipe, This recipe is a keeper.

I rated this 5 star because I love homemade cranberry sauce but, I made a few mistakes and this recipe doesn't deserve for me to rate it lower for my mistakes. I thought because I didn't have any of the whole spice berries I could adjust ground spices instead.....probably shouldn't have done that because I wasted a whole bag of cranberries. I have however learned my lesson and plan on doing it right the next time around. Thank you for sharing this recipe!
Everyone loved it, Easy and Taste great, only change I made was adding less sugar
So incredibly good. I made a double batch with two spice bags. Perfection.
Easy and Delicious.

My husband bought two bags of cranberries that made 1.75 times the recipe. I made the recipe almost exactly as written, including the full amount of sugar. The cranberry sauce came out great. In my opinion, it needs the sugar to contra the sourness of the cranberries. It would be helpful if the recipe mentioned the length of the cinnamon sticks to be used. The ones that I have are 4" in length, and the cinnamon flavor stands out in the finished cranberry sauce. It is still excellent, but I may use less cinnamon in the future. I did use orange juice instead of water as suggested by other reviewers, and brought the berries to a boil on a high temperature before turning it down to medium. I cooked it the suggested 20 minutes, added the sugar, and then cooked it an additional 10 minutes on a medium heat. It looked watery when it was done, but jelled as it cooled. This cranberry sauce is definitely better than any you can buy in the store, and you know what's in it. I might also mention that it was very easy to make.
I've made this for more than 6 years. I love it!
This is the best cranberry sauce.
This recipe is wonderful amazing

After reading other reviews, I made a couple of adjustments: I reduced the sugar to 1 cup, as I prefer it tart, substituted OJ for part of the water, and added grated orange rind. Did not have allspice and so just skipped it. I think I might have added a tad of nutmeg instead. It was still delicious and I've already been asked for the recipe! It's a very forgiving recipe, so you can play around with it however you'd like, and it's pretty foolproof. One note on timing: I used very fresh organic berries, and they burst almost instantly.
Can't believe people eat the cranberries out of a can!! These were fantastic. Used the leftovers in crepes a few days later.
Used apple cider instead of water, no leftovers.

Made this for Thanksgiving, my father, who is an excellent cook, RAVED about this, I now have a new job on Thanksgiving every year. He loved it so much we're having turkey for Christmas so I can make it again. It's an explosion of flavors in you mouth,so good! Only thing I did different was used orange juice instead of water. I'm not a fan of cranberry sauce but this, is a keeper!
The spices give the cranberries INCREDIBLE flavor!
This has become my family's favorite cranberry sauce. If you boil the sugar with the cranberries, it will come out a little thicker. I use a potato masher at the end to mash the berries.
Loved the spices in this sauce - I added some ground cloves for more flavor and couple splashes of orange juice for good measure!

I have made this twice and yes it is a little sweet but I just put some extra cinnamon in to help mask the sweet. My only problem is that both times I have made it , it has come out soupy, I might try adding some unflavored gelatin next time to see if that helps to thicken it up.
I will make this again next year! I substituted orange juice for the water, halved the sugar and threw in a pinch of cinnamon, allspice, ground cloves and nutmeg.

Love it! Because I always make my own, I modified slightly. I used apple cider instead of water, plus half a chopped apple and substituted the white sugar with 1/2 cup brown sugar, and added a little freshly grated nutmeg. Delish!
Perfect sauce
I wanted to make this cranberry sauce for Thanksgiving so I made it Saturday as A trail. It came out perfect. Will go great with our fried turkey and baked ham. Thanks for great recipes.
made no changes and loved it just as written
I make this every year! Even my kids ask for it! Try with orange juice in place of water :)
This was really simple to make but was a hit at the table. Nice recipe, fast to make, and totally delicious. This will be my go-to recipe from now on.

I used 8 cups of cranberries, 3 cups of water, 1 cup of sugar, 1 teaspoon of ground allspice, about 1/2 teaspoon of ground cinnamon, and about 1/2 teaspoon of ground cloves. (I didn't have a spice bag etc so approached the recipe this way.)

live in mexico. so ingredients are hard to find plus we don't eat sugar. only 2 of us so reduced cranberries to 1 cup, used dried cranberries because I couldn't find whole. only used 1/4 tsp stevia and used orange juice instead of water eyeballed spices because i'm not good at math. turned out GREAT. wish I could have made it the way it was written but sometimes things just don't work out the way we want however this turned out great anyway.
a little too tangy but good

This will be my third year making this. I pretty much follow the recipe (sometimes add a bit of vanilla bean, but nothing else) and it has been a huge hit. I make it for Thanksgiving and Christmas at everyone’s request and make a bit extra to have at New Years with cream cheese on crackers. Love it so much!
Replaced 1 cup of water with OJ, cut white sugar to 1/2 cup, added 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1/4 tsp nutmeg, 1/2 tsp pumpkin pie spice. Delish!

Awesome! Have made it 4 times since Thanksgiving, both with water and with orange juice (as suggested by other reviewers). Both ways were good but we preferred the orange juice. Big hit with family and friends.
Great flavors!!! Will make again but will reduce sugar to 1-1/2 cup as others have done...also great even if you follow the directions
I will definitely make this again! It was wonderful and a hit at the Thanksgiving party I brought it too. I also reduced the sugar like some were suggesting to do. It tasted much better that way.
Undercooked it a bit to keep berries more firm and used 1 less cinnamon stick...yummy, yummy!
I made this cranberry sauce and it was a hit everyone at the thanksgiving meal was asking me for the recipe the spices went perfect with the cranberries

My husband won't stop raving about this. It was the first time I have ever made or have even eaten homemade cranberry sauce. I used a coffee filter and string from a teabag to submerge the spices. I also reduced the amount of sugar to 1 and a half cups of sugar. I'm not sure if I didn't cook it long enough, but many of the berries were still whole, and it was kinda watery, so maybe cook it longer? It will be a tradition from now on. No more canned stuff for us. It was so easy. The expensive part was buying the cloves and allspice berries, but now I have enough to make it again and again, so it works out.
huge hit this Thanksgiving!
AMAZING! My new recipe. Love the spices. I used orange juice instead of water & reduced the sugar a little.

This is my husband's favorite way to have cranberry sauce. It's easy to make, though you do have to watch it as it cooks so it doesn't burn. This has become a must have item every Thanksgiving. Leftover sauce goes well with pork chops too.
I loved this it was very easy to make. Smelled awesome while it was cooking .

Couldn't be easier! And this is FANTASTIC. Is there anything better than a simple, great tasting recipe?! I did as some suggested and used orange juice for half the liquid. Definitely more like 20 min to get the majority of berries to pop. First time I made it (last week) I put the cloves, cinnamon sticks, and allspice berries in and fished them out at the end. This time I emptied a tea bag, filled with cloves and allspice, and stapled shut; cinnamon sticks went in separately. Hoping this works as I don't even know where to buy a spice bag! Over 5 days I ate ALL of this by myself. I should be ashamed, but it's soooo good! I had it with pork, all by itself and poured over vanilla ice cream. ;-)
I make this cranberry sauce every year and it's a hit! The family loves it. Super easy to make and it is delicious!!! I highly recommend. ;-)
Love it! Used less sugar (1 1/2 cup), added orange peel and substituted orange juice (freshly squeezed) for half a cup of water. Result - Thansgiving must-have! Do it!

A keeper for a basic recipe. Cut the sugar to 1 1/2 Cups and cook long for thicker texture. I also added 1/4 Cup orange juice and zest. Make it a day or two ahead and save it in the fridge. Really nice flavor.
I made this cranberry sauce for my in-laws' early Thanksgiving dinner. I added about a quarter tsp of nutmeg and ginger as well, and it was absolutely delicious!

Yummy!!! My family loves loves this cranberry sauce. For dessert try it with a slice of pound cake. You'll be coming back for more. Only thing I did different was use orange juice in place of the water.

I made this in the slow cooker and it came out great! I didn't have a spice bag so I just used ground spices to taste. The last half hour I mashed the cooked berries and added a slurry of 1tsp each cornstarch and water to thicken. I'll never buy the canned stuff again!

Great recipe! It's nice and tart, just the way I like it.
note: I ran out of white sugar, so I ended up using mostly raw sugar, which worked out fine.
